axioms.name: Divisibility Definition
axioms.statement: An integer a divides an integer b if there exists an integer k such that b = ak.

axioms.name: Properties of Divisibility
axioms.statement: If a divides b and a divides c, then a divides b+c and b-c.

axioms.name: Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) Definition
axioms.statement: The GCD of a and b is the largest integer that divides both a and b.

axioms.name: Bézout's Identity
axioms.statement: There exist integers x and y such that ax + by = gcd(a, b).

axioms.name: Euclidean Algorithm
axioms.statement: The GCD of two integers can be computed using repeated division.

axioms.name: Relatively Prime Definition
axioms.statement: Integers a and b are relatively prime if gcd(a, b) = 1.

axioms.name: Prime Number Definition
axioms.statement: A prime number is a positive integer greater than 1 whose only divisors are 1 and itself.

axioms.name: Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic
axioms.statement: Every integer greater than 1 can be uniquely factored into primes, up to order.

axioms.name: Modular Arithmetic Definition
axioms.statement: a ≡ b (mod n) if n divides (a - b).

axioms.name: Properties of Congruence
axioms.statement: Congruence modulo n is an equivalence relation and respects addition, subtraction, and multiplication.

axioms.name: Chinese Remainder Theorem
axioms.statement: If n₁, ..., nₖ are pairwise coprime, then the system of congruences has a unique solution modulo the product.

axioms.name: Fermat’s Little Theorem
axioms.statement: If p is prime and a is not divisible by p, then a^(p-1) ≡ 1 (mod p).

axioms.name: Euler's Theorem
axioms.statement: If gcd(a, n) = 1, then a^ϕ(n) ≡ 1 (mod n), where ϕ(n) is Euler's totient function.

axioms.name: Definition of Euler's Totient Function
axioms.statement: ϕ(n) is the number of positive integers ≤ n that are coprime to n.

axioms.name: Wilson’s Theorem
axioms.statement: A number p > 1 is prime if and only if (p-1)! ≡ -1 (mod p).

axioms.name: Multiplicative Inverse Modulo n
axioms.statement: An integer a has a multiplicative inverse modulo n if and only if gcd(a, n) = 1.

axioms.name: Quadratic Residue Definition
axioms.statement: An integer a is a quadratic residue modulo p if there exists an integer x such that x^2 ≡ a (mod p).

axioms.name: Legendre Symbol Definition
axioms.statement: For prime p and integer a, (a/p) = 1 if a is a quadratic residue modulo p, -1 otherwise.

axioms.name: Law of Quadratic Reciprocity
axioms.statement: For distinct odd primes p and q, (p/q)(q/p) = (-1)^((p-1)(q-1)/4).

axioms.name: Primitive Root Definition
axioms.statement: A number g is a primitive root modulo n if every number coprime to n is congruent to a power of g modulo n.
